item.title: Blitzscaling
item.description: Silicon Valley is renowned for its striking number of businesses which have grown from garage start-ups into global giants; Apple, Cisco, Google, HP and Intel to name a few. But what is the secret to their outstanding success? Hoffman and Yeh explain that it’s simple: they’ve learnt how to blitzscale.
item.dc:creator: Reid Hoffman, Chris Yeh

item.title: Trillion Dollar Coach
item.description: The team behind How Google Works returns with management lessons from legendary coach and business executive, Bill Campbell, whose mentoring of some of our most successful modern entrepreneurs has helped create well over a trillion dollars in market value
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmidt, Jonathan Rosenberg, and Alan Eagle

item.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
item.description: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck: A Counterintuitive Approach to Living a Good Life is the FCC first book by blogger and author Mark Manson. In it Manson argues that life's struggles give it meaning, and that the mindless positivity of typical self-help books is neither practical nor helpful. It was a bestseller.
item.dc:creator: Mark Manson

item.title: Bad Blood
item.description: Bad Blood: Secrets and Lies in a Silicon Valley Startup is a nonfiction book by journalist John Carreyrou, released May 21, 2018. It covers the rise and fall of the firm Theranos, the multibillion-dollar biotech startup headed by Elizabeth Holmes.
item.dc:creator: John Carreyrou
